title.narrative: EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION

description.narrative: Quality and equitable early learning Government authorities have improved capacity to deliver inclusive, gender responsive equitable and quality early childhood education, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Early Childhood Development, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Learning Outcomes, Sanitation, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, more children and adolescents, especially the most disadvantaged, have improved education and learning outcomes.

participating-org.narrative: EARLY CHILDHOOD CARE AND DEVELOPMENT COUNCIL
HANDICAP INTERNATIONAL FEDERATION PHILIPPINES BRANCH OFFICE

mailing-address.narrative: 31st Floor Yuchengco Tower Rizal Commercial Banking Corporation (RCBC) Plaza 6819 Ayala Avenue corner Gil Puyat Avenue Makati City

sector.narrative: Multisector aid for basic social services
Provision of (formal and non-formal) early-learning / pre-primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision or procurement of early-learning / pre-primary education learning materials
System strengthening - early learning / pre-primary policy, leadership, and budget
System strengthening - early learning / pre-primary teaching and learning environment (including curriculum and material design)
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
Water sector policy and administrative management

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Quality and equitable early learning Government authorities have improved capacity to deliver inclusive, gender responsive equitable and quality early childhood education

description.narrative: Through the leadership of the National ECCD Council, the national government has improved its capacity to develop holistic and multisectoral plans, policies and programmes. Significant strategic initiatives supported by UNICEF have been approved/completed which will guide and accelerate efforts to increase access to quality and holistic ECCD-ECE services, especially for children in difficult situations. These include the National ECCD Strategic Plan 2019-2030; enhanced system for addressing the needs of children with developmental delays and disabilities; and assessment of existing competencies of child development workers as basis for establishing and strengthening the system for their continuous professional development. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:07/02/2020

title.narrative: Number of children reached with pre-primary, primary and secondary online/distance education lesson with UNICEF support in the reporting year [COVID]

Proportion of 11 priority municipalities in 3 focus provinces and 1 focus city implementing the system for prevention, early identification, referral and intervention of developmental delays and disabiltiies in early early childhood, particularly for children 3-4 y/o (Additional Indicator)

target.value: 2021:100% of the 11 priority municipalities and 1 focus city with at least 40% of CDWs/CDTs in each LGU is trained on the system; SWOs in 11 priority muncipalities trained on the referral of children with developmental delays for further assessment and provision of appropriate interventions.

title.narrative: Proportion of priority municipalities in 3 focus provinces that are using the National Competency Standards for Child Development Workers and Child Development Teachers in profiling the needs, planning and implementation of capability building of at least 40% of CDWs/CDTs, per municipality
Existence of National ECCD Strategic and Investment Plan including Social and Behaviour Change Communication Strategy

actual.value: 2019:The National ECCD Strategic Plan was already approved by the ECCD Council Governing Board last 16 August 2019. The Governing Board Resolution is currently for signing

title.narrative: Existence of enhanced National Operational Guidelines on the implementation of MTB-MLE policy from pre-school to Grade 3

target.value: 2021:MTB-MLE National Operational Guidelines approved by DepED

actual.value: 2019:UNICEF and DepEd decided not to pursue the conduct of the evaluation since the Philippine Institute of Development Studies already completed its process evaluation of MTB-MLE and released the results mid of this year. Also, PIDS confirmed that it is planning to conduct the impact evaluation next yea

title.narrative: Level of implementation of the NationalECCD-Early Childhood Education M&E and Accountability System

target.value: 2021:M&E System design and enhanced Application Programming Interface (API) that will allow intermediary communication of existing information systems of DOH, NNC, DSWD, DepED and ECCDCS based on results of pilot and adopted by the ECCD Council Governing Board

actual.value: 2019:With the failure of the procurement of institutional contractor to conduct the assessment of the capacity of government in operationalizing the National ECCD M&E, UNICEF is currently undertaking the second round of the procurement process. Review of technical and financial proposals will commence i

title.narrative: Proportion of UNICEF priority municipalities in 3 focus provinces with increased 3-4 y/o enrolment rate (in Child Development Centers, Supervised Neighborhood Playgroups and other home-based ECE services), with gender parity
